H0.text: Osmosis explains how the smell of a strong perfume, opened at the front of a classroom, gradually spreads throughout the entire room.

H1.text: Diffusion is the process that explains how the smell of a strong perfume gradually spreads throughout the entire classroom when the bottle is opened at the front.

H2.text: Cell activity is the process that explains how a smell gradually spreads throughout the entire room when a bottle of strong perfume is opened at the front of a classroom.

H3.text: Cell transport is the process that explains how the smell of a bottle of strong perfume, opened at the front of a classroom, gradually spreads throughout the entire room.

A4.text: Osmosis is the movement of a solvent across a semipermeable membrane toward a higher concentration of solute.

A5.text: Diffusion of solvents, such as water, through a semipermeable membrane is classified as osmosis.

A6.text: This type of diffusion explains the net flux of molecules from a region of higher concentration to one of lower concentration.
